attributes.action: National registration of all places of worship
attributes.additional_details:
INAASA is calling for the UK government to legally acknowledge that all places of worship ( including mosques, temples, churches & independent ministries) should be registered nationally on One Central National Register.
Places of worship open doors to the most vulnerable people in society every day. Yet at present there is no government policy regulating protection of individuals.  One Central National Register of all Uk Places of worship is the first step to protecting the public from dangerous indoctrinations and Spiritual Abuse, manipulative control of religious leaders over congregants, belief of child witchcraft, hateful teachings towards other faith systems. support the interests of those who look to religion for solace and peace to be protected by law. A National Register will assist in external operational accountability and transparency in all place of worship.
